availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, farmer. Warren County, Kentucky, native. Son of John Thomas and Elizabeth Hays Thomas. Married to Rebecca D. Hays Thomas in Warren County on August 12, 1858. Father of Charles A. Thomas, John H. Thomas, and James Riley Thomas. Resident of Warren County in 1850. Household owned one enslaved person in Warren County in 1850. Farmer in Warren County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District No 2, p. 85B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District No 2.

Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, Goshen Precinct, p. 156B.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #11754.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Warren County Marriages, Film #0003398980.
"Samuel Proctor Thomas (1829-1916)," Find A Grave, Memorial #120241965, Accessed July 1, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/120241965.
